{"id":"diffview-o5z","title":"Update ClassificationInput for PR-level","description":"## Problem
Current ClassificationInput has single CommitInfo. Need to support PR-level with multiple commits.

## Changes
```go
// Before
type ClassificationInput struct {
    Commit CommitInfo
    Diff   Diff
}

// After
type ClassificationInput struct {
    Repo    string        `json:"repo"`
    Branch  string        `json:"branch"`
    Commits []CommitBrief `json:"commits"`
    Diff    Diff          `json:"diff"`
}

type CommitBrief struct {
    Hash    string `json:"hash"`
    Message string `json:"message"`
}
```

## Files
- classification.go

## Validation
- [ ] New types compile
- [ ] make validate passes","notes":"COMPLETED: Updated ClassificationInput for PR-level
- Replaced CommitInfo with CommitBrief (hash + message only)
- Changed Commit field to Commits slice
- Added Repo and Branch fields at PR level
- Added FirstCommitHash() and FirstCommitMessage() helper methods for migration
- Updated all usages in format.go, bubbletea/eval.go, cmd/diffstory/main.go
- Updated all tests (JSON keys now lowercase)

REVIEW_NOTES:
- Judgment keying by first commit hash is a known limitation, tracked in diffview-w47
- Branch field not yet populated (for downstream tasks)","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-27T11:04:04.655628-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-27T11:16:39.575504-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-27T11:16:39.575507-08:00"}

{"id":"diffview-ohe","title":"Support large diffs that exceed GitHub's render limit","description":"## Problem
GitHub shows 'Diff is too big to render' for files like eval-dataset.jsonl (7.6MB). diffview should handle these gracefully.

## Use Case
- Reviewing AI-generated code changes that span many files
- Viewing eval dataset diffs during development
- Any diff that exceeds GitHub's ~1MB render limit

## Requirements
1. diffview should render large diffs without crashing
2. Consider lazy loading / virtualization for very large diffs
3. Test with files up to 10MB+
4. Provide feedback on large file loading (progress indicator?)

## Dogfooding
This came from PR #53 where eval-dataset.jsonl couldn't be viewed on GitHub.

## Entrypoints
- bubbletea/viewer.go - current rendering
- gitdiff/parser.go - parsing large diffs

## Validation
- [ ] Can view 7.6MB JSONL diff without issues
- [ ] Memory usage stays reasonable
- [ ] UI remains responsive during load
- [ ] make validate passes","notes":"Tests confirm current implementation handles large diffs well (7.6MB in ~50ms, ~23MB memory). No lazy loading or virtualization was needed. Performance tests in bubbletea/large_diff_test.go provide a regression baseline.

Test coverage:
- TestLargeDiff_ModelCreation: verifies model creation with large diff
- TestLargeDiff_Parse: verifies parsing 7.25MB diff in <5s
- TestLargeDiff_RenderAndView: verifies rendering large diff produces output
- TestLargeDiff_PerformanceBounds: asserts time <2s, memory <200MB for 7.6MB diff
- Benchmarks for parse, model create, and render","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2025-12-27T13:23:03.438608-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-27T13:50:00.24039-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-27T13:50:00.24039-08:00","close_reason":"Performance tests confirm diffview handles large diffs (7.6MB+) without issues. Existing implementation is already performant (~50ms render, ~23MB memory). No lazy loading or virtualization needed."}

{"id":"diffview-p0s","title":"Human review of classified diffs","description":"## Problem
Need human review of 30-50 classified diffs to validate classification quality and build failure taxonomy.

## Prerequisites
- Evalreview critique input working
- Eval dataset collected and classified

## Process (Hamel's methodology)
1. Load dataset: `evalreview eval-dataset.jsonl`
2. For each case:
   - Review diff + story
   - Pass/fail judgment
   - Write detailed critique ("detailed enough for new employee")
3. Target: 30-50 cases reviewed

## Critique Guidance
For failures, explain:
- Which hunk categories are wrong?
- Is change type correct?
- Does narrative pattern fit?
- Are sections sensibly grouped?

For passes with issues:
- Note any minor problems
- Suggest improvements

## Output
- judgments JSONL with critiques
- Ready for axial coding

## Validation
- [ ] 30+ cases reviewed
- [ ] Each failure has detailed critique
- [ ] Critiques exportable for taxonomy","notes":"## Context from diffview-452 (section ordering)

Section ordering is now fully LLM-driven (OrderSections() post-processing removed).
The prompt instructs two-pass ordering: narrative order first, then sink fully-collapsed sections to end.

When reviewing ordering issues, note whether:
- Fully-collapsed sections interrupt narrative flow (should be at end)
- Section order doesn't follow expected narrative pattern","status":"open","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:10.107811-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-28T22:28:52.146218-08:00","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-dft","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:22.914446-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-cq1","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:22.948336-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-mle","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-27T10:53:39.100003-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-w47","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-27T10:54:37.596857-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

{"id":"diffview-p0s","title":"Human review of classified diffs","description":"## Problem
Need human review of 30-50 classified diffs to validate classification quality and build failure taxonomy.

## Prerequisites
- Evalreview critique input working
- Eval dataset collected and classified

## Process (Hamel's methodology)
1. Load dataset: `evalreview eval-dataset.jsonl`
2. For each case:
   - Review diff + story
   - Pass/fail judgment
   - Write detailed critique ("detailed enough for new employee")
3. Target: 30-50 cases reviewed

## Critique Guidance
For failures, explain:
- Which hunk categories are wrong?
- Is change type correct?
- Does narrative pattern fit?
- Are sections sensibly grouped?

For passes with issues:
- Note any minor problems
- Suggest improvements

## Output
- judgments JSONL with critiques
- Ready for axial coding

## Validation
- [ ] 30+ cases reviewed
- [ ] Each failure has detailed critique
- [ ] Critiques exportable for taxonomy","notes":"## Context from diffview-452 (section ordering)

Section ordering is now fully LLM-driven (OrderSections() post-processing removed).
The prompt instructs two-pass ordering: narrative order first, then sink fully-collapsed sections to end.

When reviewing ordering issues, note whether:
- Fully-collapsed sections interrupt narrative flow (should be at end)
- Section order doesn't follow expected narrative pattern

## Integration from diffview-t5f (case capture)

The 'e' keybinding is now available during eval review for saving interesting cases:
- Curated cases go to `<input>-curated.jsonl` (e.g., `eval-dataset-curated.jsonl`)
- Use to capture particularly good or bad classification examples for future eval iterations
- Format: EvalCase JSON (same as main dataset, not Judgment format)","status":"open","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:10.107811-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-28T23:13:54.887836-08:00","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-dft","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:22.914446-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-cq1","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:22.948336-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-mle","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-27T10:53:39.100003-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-p0s","depends_on_id":"diffview-w47","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-27T10:54:37.596857-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

{"id":"diffview-pgd","title":"Add prompt formatter for classification input","description":"## Problem
Need to render `ClassificationInput` as structured text for LLM prompt.

## Entrypoints
- New file: format.go or classifier.go in root package (interface)
- Implementation in gemini/ or new llm/ package

## Output Format
```
<commit_message>
Fix authentication token expiry

Tokens were not being refreshed properly when they expired.
</commit_message>

<diff>
=== FILE: pkg/auth/login.go (modified) ===

--- HUNK H1 (@@ -45,6 +45,10 @@) ---
 func (a *Auth) ValidateToken(token string) error {
+    if a.isExpired(token) {
+        return ErrTokenExpired
+    }
     return a.validator.Validate(token)
 }

--- HUNK H2 (@@ -82,3 +86,7 @@) ---
[more hunk content]

=== FILE: pkg/auth/login_test.go (added) ===
...
</diff>
```

## Interface
```go
type PromptFormatter interface {
    Format(input ClassificationInput) string
}
```

## Key Details
- Hunk IDs use format: H1, H2, H3... (sequential across all files)
- File headers show operation type: modified/added/deleted/renamed
- Include @@ line numbers in hunk headers

## Validation
- [ ] Formatter produces consistent output
- [ ] All hunks get unique IDs
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:33:45.044678-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-26T22:17:39.672618-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-26T22:17:39.672618-08:00","close_reason":"Implemented as part of epic diffview-6f7","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-pgd","depends_on_id":"diffview-ni2","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T21:34:22.779362-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

{"id":"diffview-pxa","title":"Add section indicator to StoryModel status bar","description":"## Problem

StoryModel status bar shows file/hunk position but not which section the user is viewing. The design doc specifies showing "section 2/3: Core Changes" to help users understand their position in the story.

## Approach

1. Add `currentSection()` helper that finds which section contains the current viewport position (using `sectionPositions` similar to `currentPosition()`)

2. Update `statusBarView()` to include section indicator:
   ```
   file 2/5 │ hunk 3/8 │ section 2/3: Core Changes │ 45% │ ...
   ```

3. Handle edge cases:
   - No sections (story is nil or empty)
   - Position before first section
   - Truncate long section titles if needed

## Entrypoints

- `bubbletea/story.go` - `statusBarView()` and new `currentSection()` helper

## Validation

- [ ] Section indicator shows current section number and title
- [ ] Indicator updates when navigating with s/S
- [ ] Gracefully handles empty/nil story
- [ ] make validate passes","notes":"COMPLETED: Section indicator implementation
- Added sectionIndices field to track story section index mapping
- Modified computeSectionPositions() to return both positions and indices
- Added currentSection() method to determine current section from viewport position
- Updated statusBarView() to show section indicator when sections exist
- Handle edge case: at bottom of content where viewport can't reach section position

TESTS:
- TestStoryModel_SectionIndicator: verifies indicator updates with navigation
- TestStoryModel_SectionIndicator_NoSections: verifies no indicator when empty

VALIDATION: make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":3,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-28T09:16:43.044719-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-28T10:36:00.533764-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-28T10:36:00.533764-08:00","close_reason":"Implemented section indicator in StoryModel status bar. Shows 'section X/Y: Title' when navigating through sections."}

{"id":"diffview-q24","title":"Add Palette type and update Theme interface","description":"## Problem
Root package needs Palette type as domain abstraction for colors.

## Implementation
1. Add `Color` type alias for hex strings
2. Add `Palette` struct with 18 semantic color fields:
   - Base: Background, Foreground
   - Diff: Added, Deleted, Modified, Context
   - Syntax: Keyword, String, Number, Comment, Operator, Function, Type, Constant, Punctuation
   - UI: UIBackground, UIForeground, UIAccent
3. Update `Theme` interface to include `Palette()` method

## Entrypoints
- styles.go

## Testing
- Test that Palette fields are defined (data type, no behavior)
- Verify Theme interface compiles with new method

## Validation
- [ ] Palette type has all 18 fields
- [ ] Theme interface includes Palette() method
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-25T13:53:29.350423-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-25T14:03:50.531729-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-25T14:03:50.531729-08:00","close_reason":"Closed"}

{"id":"diffview-svh","title":"Add line numbers in gutter column","description":"## Problem
No line numbers shown - users can't reference specific lines or correlate with their editor. Essential for code review workflows.

## Solution
Add a gutter column showing old/new line numbers:
```
  12    14  │  context line
  13     -  │- deleted line
   -    15  │+ added line
```

## Implementation
- Track line numbers during rendering (increment from Hunk.OldStart/NewStart)
- Use lipgloss.JoinHorizontal to compose: lineNumStyle + separator + content
- Line number style: right-aligned, fixed width, muted color
- Show '-' for lines that don't exist on that side

## Entrypoints
- bubbletea/viewer.go:210-277 (renderDiffWithPositions - add gutter rendering)
- diffview/styles.go (may need LineNumber ColorPair)

## Validation
- [ ] Old and new line numbers shown in gutter
- [ ] Numbers increment correctly per line type
- [ ] Deleted lines show number on left, '-' on right
- [ ] Added lines show '-' on left, number on right
- [ ] Context lines show both numbers
- [ ] Gutter has muted styling, doesn't distract from content
- [ ] make validate passes","notes":"COMPLETED: Line number gutter implementation
- Added LineNumber ColorPair to Styles type
- Added formatGutter and formatLineNum helper functions
- Modified renderDiffWithPositions to prepend gutter to each line
- Added tests for line number rendering
- Dark theme uses #6c7086 (muted gray)
- Light theme uses #9ca0b0 (lighter muted gray)

IN_PROGRESS: Self-review

KEY_DECISIONS:
- Gutter width is 4 chars per column (old/new)
- Format: '   1    2 │+content' with pipe separator
- Using '-' for missing line numbers (added/deleted lines)","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2025-12-23T23:51:20.396538-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-24T08:54:57.478112-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-24T08:54:57.478119-08:00"}

{"id":"diffview-szv","title":"Design and implement evalreview TUI","description":"## Problem
Need TUI for reviewing LLM-generated diff stories with pass/fail judgments.

## Design Document
See `docs/plans/2025-12-26-evalreview-tui-design.md` for full design.

## Implementation Summary

### Architecture (Ben Johnson Layout)

**Root package** (`diffview/`):
- `evalreview.go` - Domain types: `EvalCase`, `Judgment`, `EvalCaseLoader`, `JudgmentStore` interfaces

**New packages**:
- `jsonl/loader.go` - Implements `EvalCaseLoader`
- `jsonl/store.go` - Implements `JudgmentStore`

**Extend existing**:
- `bubbletea/eval.go` - `EvalModel` (separate from viewer.go)
- `bubbletea/eval_keymap.go` - Keybindings
- `mock/eval.go` - Mocks for new interfaces

**CLI**:
- `cmd/evalreview/main.go` - Entry point

### UI Layout
Vertical stack: diff panel (50%), story panel (35%), judgment bar, status bar.

### Modes
- **Review mode**: Navigate cases (j/k), scroll panels (d/s + scroll keys), judge (p/f)
- **Critique mode**: Text input (c to enter, Esc to exit)

### Data Flow
- Input: `eval/cases/*.jsonl` (EvalCase per line: commit + hunks + story)
- Output: `*-judgments.jsonl` (separate file, auto-saved)

## Implementation Order
1. Domain types in `evalreview.go`
2. JSONL loader/store with tests
3. EvalModel core (layout, navigation, scrolling)
4. Judgment capture (p/f, critique, persistence)
5. CLI entry point

## Validation
- [ ] `evalreview eval/cases/test.jsonl` launches TUI
- [ ] Navigate between cases with j/k
- [ ] Scroll diff/story independently with d/s + scroll keys
- [ ] Record pass/fail with p/f
- [ ] Enter/save critique with c/Esc
- [ ] Judgments persist to `*-judgments.jsonl`
- [ ] Re-launch loads previous judgments
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2025-12-26T14:49:41.655825-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-26T18:09:20.623714-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-26T18:09:20.62372-08:00","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-szv","depends_on_id":"diffview-3zd","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T14:49:52.806347-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-szv","depends_on_id":"diffview-41i","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-26T14:49:52.839205-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

{"id":"diffview-t0x","title":"Cache diffstory classification results by input hash","description":"## Problem

Running diffstory on the same diff repeatedly re-runs LLM classification, wasting time and API calls.

## Solution

Cache classification results keyed by input hash:
1. Hash the input diff content (SHA256 or similar)
2. Check cache before calling LLM
3. Store result with hash key on successful classification
4. Return cached result if hash matches

## Cache Design

- Location: `~/.cache/diffstory/` or XDG_CACHE_HOME
- Format: JSON files named by hash, or single SQLite DB
- Include metadata: timestamp, model version
- Consider cache expiration (or make it manual)

## Entrypoints

- `cmd/diffstory/main.go` - integrate cache lookup/storage
- New package or file for cache implementation

## Validation

- [ ] First run calls LLM and caches result
- [ ] Second run with same input returns instantly from cache
- [ ] Different input triggers new LLM call
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-28T10:40:31.51192-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-28T11:12:22.542354-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-28T11:12:22.542354-08:00","close_reason":"Closed"}

{"id":"diffview-t5f","title":"Capture current view as eval case","description":"## Problem
Building eval dataset requires running collect command on historical commits. No way to capture interesting cases encountered during normal review workflow.

## Proposed Solution
Add a keybinding (e.g., 'e' for export to eval) that:
1. Saves current ClassificationInput + StoryClassification to eval JSONL file
2. Optionally prompts for pass/fail judgment inline
3. Appends to configured eval dataset path

This enables dogfooding - building the dataset organically from real usage rather than mining historical commits. Captures the cases users actually care about.

## Entrypoints
- cmd/diffview or bubbletea UI (wherever the review UI lives)

## Validation
- [ ] Can capture case from review UI with keybinding
- [ ] Case appears in eval dataset JSONL
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"open","priority":3,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2025-12-27T11:27:03.831225-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-27T11:27:03.831225-08:00"}

{"id":"diffview-tsg","title":"Add chroma dependency and syntax token extraction","description":"## Problem
Need infrastructure for syntax highlighting using chroma library.

## Implementation
1. Add github.com/alecthomas/chroma/v2 dependency
2. Create syntax/ package following Ben Johnson pattern
3. Implement token extraction using iterator API (not quick.Highlight)
4. Use chroma.Coalesce() wrapper for performance

## Key Code Pattern
```go
lexer := lexers.Get(language)
lexer = chroma.Coalesce(lexer)
iterator, _ := lexer.Tokenise(nil, code)
for token := iterator(); token != chroma.EOF; token = iterator() {
    // extract foreground color, bold, text
}
```

## Validation
- [ ] Token extraction works for Go code
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-24T20:16:00.282715-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-24T21:27:51.467137-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-24T21:27:51.467142-08:00"}

{"id":"diffview-vqr","title":"Move interface compliance checks from tests to production code","description":"## Problem
Interface compliance checks (`var _ Interface = (*Type)(nil)`) are incorrectly placed in test files instead of production code. This provides runtime verification only, when we want compile-time guarantees.

## Files to Fix
1. `gitdiff/parser_test.go:356` → move to `gitdiff/parser.go`
2. `bubbletea/viewer_test.go:29` → move to `bubbletea/viewer.go`
3. `lipgloss/theme_test.go:17,90,136` → move to `lipgloss/theme.go` (convert inline checks to package-level)
4. `chroma/tokenizer_test.go:62` → move to `chroma/tokenizer.go`

## Validation
- [ ] All interface checks are in production files, not test files
- [ ] No functional changes - just moving declarations
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":3,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-25T13:18:38.449466-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-25T14:17:34.075341-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-25T14:17:34.075341-08:00","close_reason":"Closed"}

{"id":"diffview-w0d","title":"Parser implementation","description":"gitdiff/ package using bluekeyes/go-gitdiff. Parses unified diff, flattens file-centric to hunk-centric, computes line numbers.","notes":"COMPLETED: Parser implementation with go-gitdiff
- Created gitdiff/ package with Parser type
- Implements diffview.Parser interface
- Parses unified diff format, handles all file operations (add/delete/modify/rename/copy)
- Computes line numbers for old and new files
- Handles binary files, no-newline-at-EOF markers
- 8 passing tests covering all major scenarios

KEY_DECISIONS:
- Package named 'gitdiff' after the dependency (Ben Johnson pattern)
- go-gitdiff strips a/b prefixes from paths (library behavior, not added back)","status":"closed","priority":1,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-23T18:49:11.479258-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-23T20:18:47.669586-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-23T20:18:47.669589-08:00","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-w0d","depends_on_id":"diffview-lzy","type":"parent-child","created_at":"2025-12-23T18:49:42.042751-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-w0d","depends_on_id":"diffview-npu","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-23T18:49:53.383597-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}
// WithCaseSaver sets the saver for exporting cases to an eval dataset.
func WithCaseSaver(s diffview.EvalCaseSaver, path string) EvalModelOption {
// NewEvalModel creates a new EvalModel with the given cases.
// Best-effort save - errors are silently ignored in UI
// formatCaseForExport formats an EvalCase as markdown for LLM-assisted review.
s.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  %s    %s\n", keyStyle.Render("y"), descStyle.Render("copy case to clipboard")))
s.WriteString(fmt.Sprintf("  %s    %s\n", keyStyle.Render("e"), descStyle.Render("save case to eval dataset")))
// Create a mock saver to capture the saved case
// Wait for model to be ready
// Press 'e' to save case to eval dataset
// Wait for the save to happen
// Verify the path was passed correctly
// mockCaseSaver captures saved cases for testing.
func (m *mockCaseSaver) Save(path string, c diffview.EvalCase) error {
input         *diffview.ClassificationInput // optional: full input for constructing EvalCase
// WithStoryRenderer sets a custom lipgloss renderer for the model.
// WithStoryInput sets the classification input for constructing EvalCase when saving.
// WithStoryCaseSaver sets the saver for exporting cases to an eval dataset.
func WithStoryCaseSaver(s diffview.EvalCaseSaver, path string) StoryModelOption {
// NewStoryModel creates a new StoryModel with the given diff and classification.
if m.caseSaver == nil || m.caseSaverPath == "" || m.input == nil || m.story == nil {
// Best-effort save - errors are silently ignored in UI
// newStyle creates a new lipgloss style using the model's renderer.
dimStyle.Render("j/k:scroll  s/S:section  o:collapse  z:all  e:save  q:quit") +

story.summary: Implemented a 'save' keybinding ('e') in both the story viewer and eval review TUIs to capture curated examples for the evaluation dataset.

sections.title: Defining the Saver Contract
sections.explanation: Introduces the EvalCaseSaver interface as a domain abstraction for persisting evaluation cases, following the project's decoupling pattern.

sections.title: JSONL Implementation
sections.explanation: Provides a concrete implementation of the saver that appends EvalCase records to a JSONL file, ensuring parent directories exist before writing.

sections.title: Eval Review Integration
sections.explanation: Extends the EvalModel to support case saving, including new options, keybindings, and UI hints in the help menu.

sections.title: Story Viewer Integration
sections.explanation: Similarly integrates the saver into the standard StoryModel, allowing users to 'curate' interesting diffs during normal usage.

sections.title: CLI Entrypoints Wiring
sections.explanation: Updates the CLI tools to instantiate the JSONL saver and pass it into the Bubble Tea models.

sections.title: Verification and Mocks
sections.explanation: Provides comprehensive tests for the JSONL saver and the UI save triggers, along with updated mocks for interface compliance.

sections.title: Project Tracking
sections.explanation: Updates internal issue tracking to reflect completion of the case capture feature.

commits.message: Simplify collapse UX: remove 'o', make 'z' toggle LLM-collapsed only

Lines.Content:
{"id":"diffview-f0y","title":"Parallelize diffstory classify command","description":"## Problem
The classify command processes cases sequentially, which is slow for large datasets (96 cases takes several minutes).

## Solution
Add worker pool parallelism to the classifier:
- Add `--workers` flag (default: 4 or 8)
- Use goroutines with a semaphore/worker pool
- Collect results and write in order (preserve JSONL ordering)

## Implementation Notes
- The Gemini API supports concurrent requests
- Use errgroup for structured concurrency
- Consider rate limiting to avoid API throttling

## Entrypoints
- cmd/diffstory/main.go: ClassifyRunner

## Validation
- [ ] --workers flag accepted
- [ ] Classification runs N times faster with N workers
- [ ] Output order preserved (same as input order)
- [ ] make validate passes","notes":"## WIRING NOTES from diffview-32w
- The existing ClassifyRunner.classifyWithRetry() handles per-case retry with backoff
- When parallelizing, call classifyWithRetry() from each worker goroutine
- Collect results indexed by original position to preserve JSONL ordering
- The Classifier's timeout is per-call (applied in Classify method via context.WithTimeout), which works correctly with concurrent calls
- Consider rate limiting via semaphore to avoid overwhelming the API","status":"closed","priority":3,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2025-12-27T12:55:30.839426-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-27T14:56:40.848119-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-27T14:56:40.848121-08:00"}

{"id":"diffview-fob","title":"Update Formatter for PR context section","description":"## Problem
Formatter produces <commit_message> section. Need <context> with branch and commits.

## Changes
Before:
```
<commit_message>
Fix bug in parser
</commit_message>
```

After:
```
<context>
Repository: diffview
Branch: diffview-zv1

Commits:
- af44c89: Address PR feedback
- 51fad8d: Fix blank lines
</context>
```

## Edge Cases
- Empty commits list → omit Commits section
- Single commit → still use new format

## Files
- format.go

## Validation
- [ ] New format produces valid output
- [ ] Empty commits handled
- [ ] make validate passes","notes":"## Problem
Current DefaultFormatter doesn't include PR context (branch name, commit list) in output.

## Changes
Update Format() to include a context section before the diff:
```
## Context
Branch: feature-branch
Commits:
- abc123: Add new feature
- def456: Fix tests
```

## WIRING NOTES from diffview-qp5
- In PR-level mode: Branch is extracted from merge message (e.g., "Merge pull request #42 from user/feature-branch" -> "feature-branch")
- In commit-level fallback mode: Branch is empty string (""), Commits has exactly 1 element
- ParseBranchFromMergeMessage() in cmd/diffstory/main.go shows the extraction logic if edge cases are found

## EDGE CASE
When Branch is empty, the Formatter should still produce valid output (single-commit format or omit Branch line)

## Validation
- [ ] Context section appears before diff
- [ ] Branch name displayed when present
- [ ] Commits listed with hash and message
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-27T11:04:07.771973-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-27T12:26:47.365755-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-27T12:26:47.365758-08:00","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-fob","depends_on_id":"diffview-o5z","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-27T11:04:21.360565-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

{"id":"diffview-fx0","title":"Use diff renderer in evalreview","description":"## Problem
The evalreview diff panel renders diffs as plain text with:
1. Extra blank lines between diff lines (spacing bug)
2. No syntax highlighting or colors
3. No word-level diff highlighting

The codebase already has a sophisticated diff renderer (lipgloss/, chroma/) used by diffview.

## Investigation Needed
1. Fix the extra newline spacing in current renderer
2. Evaluate reusing existing diff rendering from diffview:
   - lipgloss/renderer.go - styled diff rendering
   - chroma/ - syntax highlighting
   - worddiff/ - word-level diff highlighting
3. Determine if these can be integrated into bubbletea/eval.go

## Entrypoints
- bubbletea/eval.go:updateViewportContent() - current plain rendering
- lipgloss/renderer.go - existing styled renderer
- cmd/diffview/ - how diffview wires up rendering

## Validation
- [ ] No extra blank lines between diff lines
- [ ] Syntax highlighting works
- [ ] Added/removed lines have color indicators","notes":"Performance baseline from diffview-ohe: existing lipgloss/chroma rendering handles 7.6MB+ diffs efficiently (~50ms). The issue is visual quality (spacing, highlighting), not performance. Benchmarks in bubbletea/large_diff_test.go available for regression testing.","status":"closed","priority":3,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-27T09:27:34.473673-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-27T14:28:25.757993-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-27T14:28:25.757993-08:00","close_reason":"Closed"}

{"id":"diffview-fyd","title":"Simplify collapse UX: remove 'o', make 'z' toggle LLM-collapsed only","description":"## Problem
Current collapse UX is confusing:
- `o` toggles 'current hunk' but there's no visual cursor/selection to indicate which hunk
- `z` toggles ALL hunks in section, even ones user explicitly expanded

## Proposed Changes

### Remove 'o' keybinding
- No good way to indicate which hunk is 'current' without a selection mechanism
- Users have to guess based on scroll position

### Change 'z' behavior
- Only toggle hunks that LLM originally marked as collapsed (noise, systematic categories)
- Don't touch hunks that were never collapsed
- This lets users quickly show/hide the 'noise' without affecting hunks they care about

## Implementation
- Remove ToggleCollapse from StoryKeyMap
- Modify toggleAllCollapse() to only affect hunks where HunkRef.Collapsed was true
- Need to track 'original collapse state' separately from 'current collapse state'

## Entrypoints
- bubbletea/story_keymap.go (remove 'o')
- bubbletea/story.go (modify toggleAllCollapse logic)

## Validation
- [ ] 'o' keybinding removed
- [ ] 'z' only toggles LLM-collapsed hunks
- [ ] User-expanded hunks stay expanded after 'z'
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"open","priority":2,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-28T23:55:06.271565-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-28T23:55:06.271565-08:00"}

- `z` toggles ALL hunks in section, even ones user explicitly expanded

## Proposed Changes

### Change 'z' behavior

## Implementation

- Need to track 'original collapse state' separately from 'current collapse state'

## Entrypoints

## Validation

{"id":"diffview-gkp","title":"Add CLI flag to select theme","description":"## Problem
No way to select a theme at runtime. Users must use whatever theme is compiled as default.

## Solution
Add a `--theme` flag to select from available themes:
```bash
git diff | diffview --theme=colorblind
git diff | diffview --theme=high-contrast
git diff | diffview --theme=light
git diff | diffview --theme=dark  # default
```

## Implementation
1. Add theme registry mapping names to theme constructors
2. Add --theme flag in cmd/diffview/main.go
3. Pass selected theme to bubbletea.NewModelWithStyles()
4. Consider auto-detection of light/dark terminal background

## Entrypoints
- cmd/diffview/main.go (add flag parsing)
- lipgloss/theme.go (add theme registry/lookup)

## Dependencies
Should come after colorblind and high-contrast themes exist.

## Validation
- [ ] --theme flag accepted
- [ ] Invalid theme names produce helpful error
- [ ] Each registered theme can be selected
- [ ] Default remains dark theme
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":3,"issue_type":"feature","created_at":"2025-12-23T23:55:40.550811-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-24T15:14:14.53044-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-24T15:14:14.53044-08:00","close_reason":"Dependencies closed. Theme flag infrastructure still valuable - will recreate when new visual direction has themes to switch between.","dependencies":[{"issue_id":"diffview-gkp","depends_on_id":"diffview-51z","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-23T23:55:48.220677-08:00","created_by":"daemon"},{"issue_id":"diffview-gkp","depends_on_id":"diffview-99k","type":"blocks","created_at":"2025-12-23T23:55:48.2993-08:00","created_by":"daemon"}]}

{"id":"diffview-hel","title":"Refactor width handling for cleaner testing","description":"## Problem
Current width handling requires sending WindowSizeMsg before positions are computed, making tests awkward:
```go
m := bubbletea.NewModel(diff)
updated, _ := m.Update(tea.WindowSizeMsg{Width: 80, Height: 24})
m = updated.(bubbletea.Model)
```

This is a hack - the abstraction should make testing easy and logical.

## Solution
Design the Model so that:
- Positions can be accessed without requiring WindowSizeMsg first
- Width-dependent rendering is cleanly separated from position tracking
- Tests don't need special setup to verify positions

## Options to explore
1. Separate position computation from rendering (positions don't depend on width)
2. Lazy computation with sensible defaults
3. Builder pattern that makes dependencies explicit

## Entrypoints
- bubbletea/viewer.go: Model struct, NewModel, renderDiffWithPositions

## Validation
- [ ] Tests can check positions without WindowSizeMsg hack
- [ ] Width-based rendering still works correctly
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":3,"issue_type":"task","created_at":"2025-12-24T11:26:12.540892-08:00","updated_at":"2025-12-24T11:39:20.012594-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-24T11:39:20.012601-08:00"}

{"id":"diffview-hg2","title":"Bug: Test sections are de-emphasized despite being unfolded","description":"## Problem

Test hunks appear gray/de-emphasized without syntax highlighting, even though they're no longer collapsed. This makes it harder to review test code.

## Root Cause

Dimming is determined by **hunk category** (refactoring, systematic, noise) in `bubbletea/render.go:113-119`:
```go
isDimmed := category == "refactoring" || category == "systematic" || category == "noise"
```

Test hunks often get classified as "refactoring" or "systematic" by the LLM, triggering dimming regardless of their section role.

## Proposed Fix

In the dimming logic, also check the **section role**. If a hunk is in a "test" section, don't dim it regardless of category. The renderer already receives `hunkToSection` mapping - it just needs to also receive section roles.

## Entrypoints
- `bubbletea/render.go:113-119` - dimming logic
- `bubbletea/story.go:117-138` - where categories/sections are mapped

## Validation
- [ ] Test hunks have full syntax highlighting
- [ ] Test hunks show add/delete colors (not muted gray)
- [ ] Non-test refactoring/systematic hunks still dimmed
- [ ] make validate passes","status":"closed","priority":2,"issue_type":"bug","created_at":"2025-12-28T22:02:31.550566-08:00","created_by":"filip","updated_at":"2025-12-28T22:45:24.687894-08:00","closed_at":"2025-12-28T22:45:24.687896-08:00"}

story.summary: Simplifies the collapse UX by removing the unreliable 'o' hunk toggle and refining the 'z' toggle to specifically target hunks automatically flagged as noise by the LLM.

sections.title: Core Logic and State Management
sections.explanation: Introduces tracking for 'llmCollapsedHunks' to distinguish between runtime user actions and original AI classification. This allows the 'z' key to precisely toggle only the automatically hidden 'noise' while leaving user-expanded hunks untouched.

sections.title: Behavioral Validation
sections.explanation: Comprehensive tests ensuring the removal of the 'o' keybinding, verifying that 'noise' hunks are collapsed by default, and confirming the 'z' key correctly toggles only LLM-collapsed hunks.

sections.title: Removal of Obsolete UX

hunks.collapse_text: Updated keymap to remove 'o' and clarify 'z' help text

sections.explanation: Cleans up the codebase by removing the 'o' keybinding and its associated logic, which lacked a clear visual cursor for users.

sections.title: UI Feedback
sections.explanation: Updates the footer help text to reflect the new keyboard shortcuts.

sections.title: Project Metadata
sections.explanation: Updates the issue tracker to reflect the completion of the collapse UX simplification.
